segments.text: That overflowing sink is disgusting—water everywhere like a filthy flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor, soaking her shoe, ugh.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, clueless, drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water's streaking down the cabinets, probably ruining the wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids? Sneaking cookies like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's hand deep in the jar—germs, mess, all of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool's unstable; he'll fall into the wet mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's right there, enabling the whole sloppy affair.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked up, waiting to get splashed next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window shows a clean garden—why can't inside be like that?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen's turning into a swamp, and no one cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand watching this chaos build up.
segments.speaker: PAR
